title: Tiffany Hartwell Memorial Window Coaster Set
description:
Coaster set developed from (attributed to) Agnes F. Northrop and Tiffany Studios, Tiffany Hartwell Memorial Window, 1917, from The Art Institute of Chicago’s collection.

The Hartwell Memorial Window is one of the most extraordinary leaded glass windows ever made by Tiffany Studios, the leading glass firm of America’s Gilded Age. Attributed to Agnes Northrop, the Hartwell Memorial Window stands 23 feet high by 16 feet wide. Made up of 48 separate panels, it is a technical marvel in the medium of glass and a work of stunning beauty. 

  • Dimensions: 4.125 x 4.125 x .25 in.
  • Materials: Absorbent Stone, corked bottom.
  • Set of 4 coasters, each with different image.
  • Care instructions on packaging.
